Lucio Urtubia, son of Cascante (Navarra) Spain. 

 Lucio Urtubia was born in Cacante in a very poor family of 5 brothers, inside the Carlist Navarre. His father went to prison and become communist. At 19 years old Lucio heard from his mouth for the first time the word that would mark his life: "If I could start over, would be an anarchist." 

Conscripted for military service, soon discovered facility for contraband in the Spanish-French border. Later, with other services, robbed the store where the company provided its own service. When he was discovered, deserted and fled to France in 1954, because the crimes could lead him to the death penalty. 

In Paris he began to work as a bricklayer, who will officially join his entire life.
